snippet: From the hoarding of staples to canceled trips by holidaymakers to destabilizing currency fluctuations, the effects of the effort to force Tehran to halt its nuclear program are making everyday life more difficult, Robert F. Worth reports from...
abstract: From the hoarding of staples to canceled trips by holidaymakers to destabilizing currency fluctuations, the effects of the effort to force Tehran to halt its nuclear program are making everyday life more difficult, Robert F. Worth reports from Tehran. And the new sanctions have not yet taken hold.

headline.main: Feeling Sanctions' Bite in the Streets of Iran
